definition: to engrave (on wood or stone)/to inscribe
quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals

sentences.english: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!
sentences.chinese: 用铁笔镌刻，用铅灌在磐石上，直存到永远。

sentences.english: Inscribed above the door, "security", local people said that this was South openings .
sentences.chinese: 门洞上方镌刻“保障”二字，当地人说，这是南门洞。

sentences.english: So much of British andChinese history is recorded here.
sentences.chinese: 那么多的英国和中国的历史被镌刻在这里。

sentences.english: Quality compared with Tianhuang thicker, engraved and Tianhuang also feel completely different.
sentences.chinese: 与田黄相比质稍粗，镌刻的感觉也和田黄完全不同。

sentences.english: On their reverse side, the medals are inlaid with jade with the Beijing Games emblem engraved in the metal centerpiece.
sentences.chinese: 奖牌背面内嵌中华玉，正中央镌刻着北京奥运会会徽。

sentences.english: Chinese famous brand must be the token of Dragon.
sentences.chinese: 中国品牌要镌刻下龙的记号。

sentences.english: The colorful agates are engraved for pursuing lofty spirit.
sentences.chinese: 绚丽的玛尼石，镌刻着崇高的精神追求。

sentences.english: Therefore, lets us remember always that own status, engrave their trail.
sentences.chinese: 所以，让我们铭记自己的身份，镌刻自己的足迹。

sentences.english: Stone tablets throughout the grounds testify to the generosity of patrons from all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 地上的碑碣镌刻着世界各地捐款者的慈善事迹。

definition: to engrave a seal/stamp mark/to print with carved type/to leave a deep impression
to brand (cattle etc)/brand/(fig.) to leave a lasting mark/to stigmatize/mark/stamp/stigma
to inlay/to embed/to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring)/tiling/tesselation
see 赤嵌樓|赤嵌楼[Chi4 kan3 lou2]
stele/vertical stone tablet for carved inscriptions
